name: hc_wastewater_h2s_fz
description: [HC] H2S wastewater + GDB FZ ‚Üí BLOCK (zinc attacked), suggest SF
query: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

turns.content: Wastewater plant exhaust. Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) present. We want GDB in FZ.

This configuration for the wastewater plant exhaust is blocked. The GDB filter housing with FZ (C3 galvanized) material is not suitable for this environment.The wastewater treatment application exposes the system to Chemical Vapor Exposure and H2S / Hydrogen Sulfide Corrosion. The H2S will corrode the C3 galvanized steel (FZ) very quickly. The housing corrosion class is C2.No standard catalog product is rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation. The product uses SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.To resolve this, a solution would need to be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER and use a material with a corrosion class of C5 or higher. Since no standard catalog product currently satisfies these requirements, I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly blocked a request that would have resulted in rapid equipment failure. It accurately identified that galvanized steel (FZ) is unsuitable for a wastewater environment containing Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S), citing the correct corrosion class mismatch (C2/C3 vs C5). The engineering reasoning regarding chemical corrosion is sound, and the refusal to recommend a standard product for this hazardous application is the safe, professional choice.

dimension_explanations.correctness: The system correctly identifies GDB as 'oisolerat enkelv√§ggsutf√∂rande' (PDF p.8) and notes the corrosion class mismatch (FZ is C2/C3 per PDF p.4/8, while H2S requires C5/Stainless).
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response fully addresses the user's constraint by explaining why it is blocked and suggesting the correct path (Custom Engineering for C5 materials).
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent safety intervention; preventing the use of zinc-coated steel in an H2S environment prevents rapid corrosion and structural failure.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and authoritative regarding the safety block.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The logic is flawless: H2S causes corrosion -> FZ (Zinc) is susceptible -> Housing is only C2 rated -> Application requires C5 -> Block.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to the engineering constraints of the materials listed in the PDF.

strengths: Correctly identified H2S as a critical corrosion risk for galvanized steel
Accurately cited GDB construction details (single-wall, uninsulated) from the PDF
Appropriately directed the user to custom engineering rather than guessing a standard part
pdf_citations: GDB standard material: 'Korrosivitets klass C2' (PDF p.8)
FZ material definition: 'F√ñRZINKAT... korrosivitets klass C3' (PDF p.4)

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that galvanized (FZ) is a poor choice for H2S-laden wastewater exhaust and appropriately blocks the requested configuration on corrosion grounds. However, it makes several incorrect or unsupported claims about the GDB‚Äôs corrosion class, construction, and suitability versus available higher-corrosion materials in the catalog, and it fails to propose a viable standard alternative (e.g., ZM/RF/SF) that the catalog indicates is possible.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF shows GDB is available in multiple materials (FZ/AZ/RF/SF/ZM icons on the GDB page) and GDB 600x600 has Fl√∂de 3400 m¬≥/h; the system‚Äôs engineering point that FZ will corrode quickly in H2S is sound, but stating ‚Äúhousing corrosion class is C2‚Äù and ‚Äúsingle-wall uninsulated does not meet leakage/hygiene requirements‚Äù is not supported and partly contradicts the PDF (EN 15727/EN 1886 testing is stated).
dimension_explanations.completeness: It blocks the unsafe choice but does not explore standard catalog alternatives (e.g., ZM or stainless) or ask key follow-ups (outdoor/indoor, washdown, required leakage class, connection type, size/flow).
dimension_explanations.safety: Good risk awareness: H2S/wastewater exhaust is highly corrosive and blocking FZ is prudent; recommending escalation to engineering support is appropriate.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional, clear, and appropriately cautionary for a technical sales/engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Reasoning is partially logical (H2S ‚Üí corrosion ‚Üí avoid FZ) but includes unsupported leaps about leakage class/hygiene and an absolute claim that no standard product is suitable without checking higher-grade materials.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly refuses the user‚Äôs requested GDB-in-FZ for this duty, but incorrectly asserts no standard catalog product can meet the need despite the catalog indicating higher corrosion-class materials (ZM/RF/SF) are available for the family.

strengths: Appropriately blocks galvanized (FZ) for H2S-laden wastewater exhaust based on sound corrosion engineering judgment.
Maintains a professional tone and clearly communicates that the requested configuration is high-risk.
weaknesses: Incorrect/unsupported product claims (e.g., calling GDB ‚Äòsingle-wall uninsulated‚Äô as a disqualifier and stating ‚Äòhousing corrosion class is C2‚Äô), and mischaracterizes leakage/hygiene requirements.
Fails to propose a standard alternative material (ZM/RF/SF) that the catalog indicates is available for GDB, and does not request key design parameters.
pdf_citations: GDB 600x600: Fl√∂de = 3400 m¬≥/h; available lengths 550/600 and 750/800 (GDB M√ÖTT table).
GDB is tested for leakage through casing, strength, and filter bypass leakage per EN 15727:2010 and EN 1886:2007 (GDB description page).

content_segments.text: This configuration for the wastewater plant exhaust is blocked. The GDB filter housing with FZ (C3 galvanized) material is not suitable for this environment.
The wastewater treatment application exposes the system to
Chemical Vapor Exposure and H2S / Hydrogen Sulfide Corrosion
inference_logic: Chemical Vapor Exposure is present in wastewater treatment plants.
H2S (hydrogen sulfide) aggressively attacks zinc coatings.
FZ (C3 galvanized) corrodes rapidly in H2S environments.
Minimum C5 material required (RF or SF).

content_segments.text: . The H2S will corrode the C3 galvanized steel (FZ) very quickly. The housing corrosion class is C2.

No standard catalog product is rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation. The product uses SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.

To resolve this, a solution would need to be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER and use a material with a corrosion class of C5 or higher. Since no standard catalog product currently satisfies these requirements, I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.
